Class ExPANdS

java.lang.Object
  ExPANdS

public class ExPANdS
extends java.lang.Object

Class used by the R-package EXPANDS (Expanding Ploidy and Allele Frequency on Nested Subpopulations), that characterizes coexisting SPs in a tumor using copy number and B-allele frequencies derived from exome- or whole genome sequencing input data. Functionality provides exhaustive iteration through scenarios that explain the B-allele frequency and copy number measured for a given locus, while considering cell type specific ploidies, cellular frequencies and noise in copy number measurements . Functionalities concern individual point mutations only, rather than mutation clusters.

Author:
Noemi

Nested Class Summary
 class ExPANdS.FitAlternatives
          Stores alternative cellular frequencies f, that fit the equations: PM*f+PN*(1-f)=CN and PM_B*f+PN_B*(1-f)=CN*AF, where CN and AF are copy number and B-allele frequency measurements derived from NGS, while (PM, PN, PM_B, PN_B)=(total ploidy in mutated cells, total ploidy in normal cells, B-allele ploidy in mutated cells, B-allele ploidy in normal cells) are fixed.
 class ExPANdS.Solution
          Stores alternative solutions (PM_B, PM, f)=(B-allele ploidy, total ploidy, cellular frequency) computed for the NGS derived measures: AF - B-allele frequency, CN - copy number and PN_B - ploidy of the B-allele in normal cells, that are associated with a mutated locus.
 
Field Summary
private  double AF
          Observed/measured B-allele frequency
private  double[] alternativeCN
          Copy number alternatives obtained by adding different levels of noise to the measured copy number: alternativeCN:=(CN - maxCN_Error):(CN + maxCN_Error), where CN is the measured copy number and maxCN_error is the maximal level of noise.
private  ExPANdS.FitAlternatives bestSolution
          Cellular frequency alternatives for fixed PM and PM_B

solutions

private java.util.List<ExPANdS.FitAlternatives> solutions
Alternative solutions, consisting of (PM, PM_B, f). Each entry in the list consists of fixed values for PM and PM_B and variable f (frequency of mutated cell)

The error associated with the currently best solution

alternativeCN

private double[] alternativeCN
Copy number alternatives obtained by adding different levels of noise to the measured copy number: alternativeCN:=(CN - maxCN_Error):(CN + maxCN_Error), where CN is the measured copy number and maxCN_error is the maximal level of noise.

Constructor Detail

ExPANdS

public ExPANdS(double af,
               double cn,
               int pnb,
               int max_PM)
Calculates alternative solutions, consisting of (PM, PM_B, f) =(total ploidy in mutated cells, B-allele ploidy in mutated cells, frequency of mutated cells), that can explain B-allele frequency and copy number measured for a single mutated locus.

Parameters:
af - measured B-allele frequency
cn - measured copy number
pnb - ploidy of the B-allel in normal cells
max_PM - maximal total ploidy in mutated cells
Method Detail

getDeviation

public double getDeviation()
Deviation between observed and expected values for B-allele frequency and copy number. The value of this function is 0, if and only if the components of the best solution yield exactly the same copy number and allele frequency as measured.

Returns:
the deviation of the observed from the expected copy number and allele frequency, for the inferred solution

run

public void run()
Exhaustive iteration through all possible combinations of (PM,PM_B,f), while considering copy number noise

getPM_B

public int getPM_B()
B-allele ploidy of this locus, obtained by minimizing the deviation between observed and expected B-allele frequency and copy number.

Returns:
ploidy of the B-allele

getPM

public int getPM()
Total ploidy of this locus, obtained by minimizing the deviation between observed and expected B-allele frequency and copy number.

Returns:
total ploidy

getF

public double getF()
Frequency of cells harboring the mutation at this locus, obtained by minimizing the deviation between observed and expected B-allele frequency and copy number.

Returns:
cellular frequency

solutions

Alternative solutions (PM_B, PM, f)=(B-allele ploidy, total ploidy, cellular frequency) computed to explain NGS derived allele frequency and copy number measurements.

Returns:
List of alternative solutions
